dcterms:creator: F. Chollet
dcterms:description: The Abstraction & Reasoning Corpus (ARC) is a general intelligence test designed to assess core knowledge priors through visual reasoning tasks. It consists of 1,000 tasks divided into a public training set, a public evaluation set, and a private test set, with tasks presented as input-output grid pairs.
dcterms:title: Abstraction & Reasoning Corpus (ARC)

dcterms:creator: P. A. Carpenter
M. A. Just
P. Shell
dcterms:description: Raven’s Progressive Matrices (RPM) is a well-known intelligence test that assesses abstract reasoning through visual patterns. It consists of 60 problems that require the solver to identify the missing element in a series of visual patterns.
dcterms:title: Raven’s Progressive Matrices (RPM)

dcterms:creator: F. Chollet
dcterms:description: The ARC public training set consists of 400 tasks designed for training AI systems to solve visual reasoning problems. It is part of the larger Abstraction & Reasoning Corpus.
dcterms:title: ARC public training set

dcterms:creator: F. Chollet
dcterms:description: The ARC public evaluation set consists of 400 tasks designed for evaluating AI systems' performance on visual reasoning problems. It is part of the larger Abstraction & Reasoning Corpus.
dcterms:title: ARC public evaluation set

dcterms:creator: F. Chollet
dcterms:description: The ARC private test set consists of 200 tasks that are used for testing AI systems' performance on visual reasoning problems. Access to this set is typically granted through submissions to ARC challenge platforms.
dcterms:title: ARC private test set
